stem: Given question: What do people do sometimes when they find a good deal? and answer: fight each other, explain why in
no_more_50_words: Malls sometimes have sales, e.g., on black friday, when they offer good deals; however, the items are sometimes in limited supply, which can cause altercations between folks, each trying to buy the same item.
150_to_200_words: People sometimes fight each other when they find a good deal because they want to be the first to get the item or service at a discounted rate. People can be so desperate to save money that they become aggressive and resort to physical confrontation. The desire to get a good deal can also lead to a sense of entitlement, where they feel they are entitled to the item or service and will do whatever it takes to get it. They may also be competing with others to get the item or service, leading to physical altercations. People may also fight each other out of fear that if they don't get the item or service, someone else will, leading to a sense of desperation. Finally, people may fight each other for the thrill of the chase. Fighting for something that is highly desired can be an adrenaline rush for some people, leading them to act impulsively and recklessly.
